snippet: After her family was evicted, Wendy Jerido, 20, lived in a shelter and grew dispirited, but she is back on track, hoping to become a police officer, a dance teacher or a social worker.
abstract: Brooklyn Community Services, one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Wendy Jerido with funds to pay for her college application.
lead_paragraph: After her family was evicted, Wendy Jerido, 20, lived in a shelter and grew dispirited, but she is back on track, hoping to become a police officer, a dance teacher or a social worker.

headline.seo: Trying for College, and a Room of Her Own
headline.main: 20-Year-Old Trying for College and a Place of Her Own
